com.stormpath.sdk.oauth
Interface AccessTokenRequestAuthenticator

public interface AccessTokenRequestAuthenticator

Authenticates an API request attempting to obtain a new OAuth Access Token. This request is usually submitted to the application's OAuth token endpoint (e.g. /oauth/token). The request is authenticated using the OAuth 2 Client Credentials Grant Type, and the new token will be available in the returned AccessTokenResult.

This interface reflects the Builder design pattern so that the request authentication process may be customized.

Usage Example

 //assume a POST request to, say, https://api.mycompany.com/oauth/token:

 public void processOauthTokenRequest(HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response) {

    Application application = client.getResource(myApplicationRestUrl, Application.class);

    //if you want to control the OAuth scope (aka application-specific permissions) that should be granted to the
    //generated token (and will be retained as long as the token is alive):
    ScopeFactory scopeFactory = new MyScopeFactory(); //create the 'MyScopeFactory' class yourself

    AccessTokenResult result = (AccessTokenResult)application.authenticateOauthRequest(request)
        .using(scopeFactory)
        .withTtl(3600)
        .execute();

    TokenResponse token = result.getTokenResponse();

    response.setStatus(HttpServletResponse.SC_OK);
    response.setContentType("application/json");
    response.getWriter().print(token.toJson());

    response.getWriter().flush();
 }

Since:
1.0.RC
See Also:
Application.authenticateOauthRequest(Object), using(ScopeFactory), withTtl(long), execute()

Method Summary
 AccessTokenResult execute()
          Executes this authentication request.
 AccessTokenRequestAuthenticator using(ScopeFactory scopeFactory)
          Specifies the ScopeFactory to be used during authorization request processing.
 AccessTokenRequestAuthenticator withTtl(long ttl)
          Specifies the generated access token's time to live in seconds.
 

Method Detail

using

AccessTokenRequestAuthenticator using(ScopeFactory scopeFactory)
Specifies the ScopeFactory to be used during authorization request processing. This allows you to generate and assign permissions to the OAuth API client that can be checked later on subsequent requests. See ScopeFactory for more information.

If not specified, an empty scope will be used.

Parameters:
scopeFactory - the ScopeFactory to be used for this authentication request.
Returns:
this instance for method chaining.

withTtl

AccessTokenRequestAuthenticator withTtl(long ttl)
Specifies the generated access token's time to live in seconds. If not provided the default ttl (3600 seconds) will be used.

Parameters:
ttl - the time to live (in seconds) of this authentication request.
Returns:
this instance for method chaining.

execute

AccessTokenResult execute()
Executes this authentication request.

Returns:
the result of the authentication request in the form of a AccessTokenResult.
